main_00_001: Here is YTLA, an (AI-evaluated enterprise-level) web application designed for better... slacking off???
main_00_002: You can use it for various purposes
main_00_003: Studying, reading books, creating photo albums or galleries, workflow collaboration, brainstorming ideas, even visually managing your digital resources and data
main_00_004: ......And of course (MUST HAVE!!!) slacking off, that's the most important!
main_00_005: You can also explore its architecture and try to develop your own tool components
main_01_001: YTLA offers two main content types: Templates and Cards
main_01_002: Templates help you efficiently handle various tasks, while Cards provide diverse auxiliary functions
main_01_003: Check the adjacent page for detailed features of Templates and Cards
main_01_004: Create Plans (think of them as folders) to organize templates into different projects
main_01_005: Use the left taskbar to quickly switch between your Plans
main_01_006: Hover over the top-right corner — see the floating black bar? Click it to open the Card Panel
main_01_007: Find the 'Add Card' button at the top of the Card Panel to quickly create new Cards
